bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign apparent as localized burning heat in the skin. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 36: 云是野狐尿棘 刺頭，有人犯之者，則多中於人手指、足指，腫痛焮熱。有端居不出而 著此毒者，則不必是狐尿刺也，蓋惡毒氣耳。故方亦云惡刺毒者也 , “It is said that this is because the urine of a wild fox has pierced the head. When a person encounters it, he often experiences swelling, pain and scorching heat at the fingers and toes. If someone lives properly and does not go out, and still is affected by this poison, then this is certainly not a fox urine piercing. Rather this is malign poison qi. Hence the recipe also speaks of poisoning from a malign sting”.
